thread.title: Militants threaten to force out moderate councillors
thread.title_full: Militants threaten to force out moderate councillors

title: Militants threaten to force out moderate councillors
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Militants threaten to force out moderate councillors Two moderate councillors have already quit Labour over Jeremy Corbyn's election and others say they have been warned that they face deselection Jon Enoch/Times Newspapers Ltd Google+ 1 of 1 Two moderate councillors have already quit Labour over Jeremy Corbyn's election and others say they have been warned that they face deselection Jon Enoch/Times Newspapers Ltd Lucy Fisher Senior Political Correspondent Published 1 minute ago 
Hard-left activists are threatening to force the deselections of moderate Labour councillors, it has emerged, while two local government politicians have quit the party over the election of Jeremy Corbyn as leader. 
Ken Ferrett, a councillor in Portsmouth, resigned from the Labour party last month after 21 years of membership, citing abuse from far-left activists and his disillusionment with Mr Corbyn’s policy positions. 
In his resignation letter, he said: “As the recent leadership election progressed, I grew increasingly alarmed at the direction the party had chosen to take and horrified at the abuse relentlessly meted out to loyal, committed and Subscribe now
